intro: Spermacoce brachystema, commonly known as the small-stemmed bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite and often hairy, with a distinct aromatic scent. Spermacoce brachystema produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps, which disperse its seeds effectively in the wild.
